title: WWE's Paige wants to follow The Rock to Hollywood and become movie star
text:
Paige is keen for more Hollywood roles (Picture: WWE)

WWE superstar Paige would love a career in Hollywood.

The former women’s champion’s life was turned into a blockbuster movie earlier this year by Dwayne Johnson and Stephen Merchant, and after her own career was cut short by injuries the Norwich-born star is hoping she could follow The Rock’s footsteps from the ring to the big screen.

Asked if she’d like to make it in the film industry, she told the Metro.co.uk: ‘Oh yeah! Well, I can’t wrestle anymore- so give me a job, Hollywood!’

Fighting With My Family was released in February, and it told the story of Paige (played by Florence Pugh) and her loved ones as she made it from the UK independent scene to the dazzling lights of WWE.

The movie shone a light on her own journey and life back home, and the superstar will be forever grateful to The Rock – who produced and made a cameo in the film – for bringing her life to the big screen.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Both Paige and Dwayne were backstage at the Staples Center for Friday Night Smackdown’s launch last week, and she said: ‘Oh my gosh, he’s the biggest hero ever! He’s been incredible.

‘I’m so happy I get to see him again, I haven’t seen him for a while. The movie was just incredible and it took off so wonderfully, it was number one in the UK. I just thank him so much – he elevated my family so much.’

Fighting With My Family also starred Game of Thrones’ Lena Headey and Hot Fuzz actor Nick Fost as Paige’s parents Julia and Ricky Knight respectively, while Jack Lowden played her brother Zak.

Vince Vaughn appeared as fictional WWE recruiter and coach Hutch Morgan, while real life WWE superstars like The Miz, Big Show and Sheamus all made an appearance.

Paige would be in good company if she did make the switch the Hollywood, with Dave Bautista and John Cena also making waves of their own in recent years.

*Friday Night SmackDown airs every week at 1am on Sky Sports. WWE will be touring the UK next month with a huge double TV taping featuring both Raw and SmackDown superstars in Manchester on 8 8 November.
description: The wrestler can no longer get in the ring so is looking for film opportunities after The Rock success.
